interlocking filet crochet things to know all notes are written using standard u s terms additional terms have been created to define the various diagonal stitches general the right side rs refers to the design side of the work the wrong side ws refers to the hidden or non-public side of the work front f refers to mesh stitches made on the side of the work facing you back b refers to mesh stitches made on the side of the work facing away from you a window is defined as the square space created by a mesh stitch on the right and left side and a chain stitch at the top and bottom main color mc mesh stitches are only worked into the top of a mc mesh stitch contrasting color cc mesh stitches are only worked into the top of a cc mesh stitch mesh stitches f or b are worked as a double_crochet double_crochet if necessary pull the top of the stitch to work into to the front or back of the work through the window of the opposite color chain 1 skip chain-1 space after each mesh stitch the number following the f or b indicates the number of consecutive front or back mesh stitches to make when no number is listed once is implied outside stitches refer to the double_crochet at the ends of mc row at the end of the row the double_crochet are worked into the top of the same color outside stitch as follows skip 1 chain of turning chain double_crochet in next chain inside stitches refer to the double_crochet at the ends of cc row at the end of the row the double_crochet are worked in either the front or back into the same color inside stitch as follows skip 1 chain of turning chain double_crochet in next chain chain 4 at the end of each row counts as outside or inside stitch + chain 1 for next row when a row is complete place stitch marker in the last chain of the turning chain
